parks.weatherInfo: Gateway National Recreation Area includes several separate land areas spread throughout the New York metropolitan area. The New York area experiences four distinct seasons. Temperatures are moderate in the spring and fall, but range from the high 90's during the summer to snow and sleet in winter.
parks.name: Gateway

parks.description: The 25 miles of free-flowing Gauley River and the six miles of the Meadow River pass through scenic gorges and valleys containing a wide variety of natural and cultural features. The Gauley River contains several class V+ rapids, making it one of the most adventurous white water boating rivers in the east.

entranceFees.description: There is no fee to enter Gauley River National Recreation Area. Enjoy your visit!
entranceFees.title: Entrance Fees

entrancePasses.description: There is no fee to enter Gauley River National Recreation Area, so there is no need for an entrance pass. Enjoy your visit!
entrancePasses.title: Entrance Passes

parks.directionsInfo: Plane The largest airport is at Charleston, about 65 miles from Summersville. There are also small airports at Summersville and Beckley. Car The main entrance to Gauley River National Recreation Area is located off US Route 19 south of Summersville and north of Fayetteville, West Virginia. Turn off US Route 19 onto WV Route 129 toward Summersville Dam. Take the second left after you cross over the dam and follow the signs to Gauley River.

operatingHours.description: The area is open year round. The official Gauley boating season is from early September through mid October. Boating is occasionally possible at other times, depending on water releases from Summersville Dam.
operatingHours.name: Gauley River National Recreation Area

parks.weatherInfo: Weather in the Appalachian Mountains can be unpredictable and can change quickly. Always be prepared for the possibility of sudden storms. Weather in the mountains is often cooler and wetter than the surrounding area. On average, the warmest month is July. The maximum average precipitation also occurs in July.
parks.name: Gauley River

parks.description: The final resting place of President Ulysses S. Grant and his wife, Julia, is the largest mausoleum in North America. It testifies to a people’s gratitude for the man who ended the bloodiest conflict in American history as Commanding General of the Union Army and then, as President of the United States, strove to heal a nation after a civil war and make rights for all citizens a reality.

emailAddresses.description: Contact us here for any park inquiries

entranceFees.description: Admission to this park site is free of charge.
entranceFees.title: Entrance Fee

entrancePasses.description: No Passes Available For Sale
entrancePasses.title: No Passes Available For Sale

parks.directionsInfo: General Grant National Memorial is located in Riverside Park, on the upper west-side of Manhattan. The entrance to the mausoleum is between north-bound and south-bound Riverside Drive, near the intersection of West 122nd Street. The visitor center is located to the west, across south-bound Riverside Drive. Street parking is available, but can be very hard to find. The area is well-served with both Bus and Subway, by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority of New York (http://www.mta.info/).

operatingHours.description: Visitor Center is located across Riverside Drive and to the west of the Mausoleum
operatingHours.name: Visitor Center

operatingHours.description: These hours here represent the hours that the general public can access the outdoor areas of the front plaza and the covered area of the overlook pavilion
operatingHours.name: Front Plaza and Overlook Pavilion

operatingHours.description: The indoor areas of the Mausoleum are open 10 am to 5 pm Wednesday to Sunday.
operatingHours.name: Mausoleum (Tomb)

images.title: Mausoleum
images.altText: Mausoleum and flags in sunny weather
images.caption: The Mausoleum is the final resting place for Ulysses S Grant and his wife Julia D. Grant.

images.title: The Sarcophagi of Ulysses and Julia Grant
images.altText: Two red stone sarcophagi are in a crypt. A bust of General Sherman can be seen in the distance.
images.caption: Two sarcophagi, made of granite from Wisconsin, house the remains of Ulysses S. Grant and his wife, Julia. Bronze busts of key union generals (like William T. Sherman seen here) occupy the  niches in the lower crypt.

images.title: The Upper Dome of the Mausoleum
images.altText: A circular dome is held up by carvings of allegorical figures.
images.caption: The dome of the memorial stretches 150 feet into the sky. On its four corners are four allegorical sculptures, executed by J. Massey Rhind.

images.title: The Overlook Pavillion, above the Visitor Center
images.altText: A neoclassic pavilion sits on the hillside, surrounded by trees with the Hudson River below.
images.caption: The Overlook Pavilion is great place to check out the scenery. Beneath the overlook is the park's visitor center.

images.title: Site of the Temporary Tomb
images.altText: A black wrought-iron fence surrounds two trees. The enclosure is located directly behind the tomb.
images.caption: This enclosure marks the location of the temporary vault where Grant was initially interred. His remains were in the temporary vault for 12 years, from 1885-1897.

images.title: U S Military Academy at West Point Colorguard
images.altText: West Point Cadets in formal uniforms carrying three flags in front of the mausoleum
images.caption: Visit the site on the Birthday Ceremony for U.S. Grant

parks.fullName: George Rogers Clark National Historical Park
parks.description: The British flag would not be raised above Fort Sackville Feb. 25, 1779. At 10 a.m., the garrison surrendered to American Colonel George Rogers Clark. His American army, aided by French residents of the Illinois country, had marched through freezing floodwaters to gain this victory. The fort’s capture assured United States claims to the frontier, an area nearly as large as the original 13 states.

entranceFees.description:
There is no fee to tour George Rogers Clark National Historical Park. As a result of being a fee-free park, George Rogers Clark NHP no longer sells the America the Beautiful National Park passes.

The nearest locations to purchase these passes is Hoosier National Forest in Bedford, Indiana (www.fs.usda.gov/hoosier), and is located approximately 70 miles from Vincennes.
entranceFees.title: Entrance Fee

parks.directionsInfo: The George Rogers Clark National Historical Park is located within the city of Vincennes, Indiana. Evansville is approximately 50 miles to the south and Terre Haute is approximately 50 miles to the north. Highway 41 provides good roads from the north or south. Highway 50 provides access from the east and west. From Hwy 50 east and west or from Hwy 41 from the north use the 6th Street exit. On Hwy 41 from the South use the Willow Street exit. From there follow the blue directional signs for the park.

exceptions.name: Birthday of Martin Luther King, Jr. Closed

operatingHours.description: The park is open seven days a week and is closed on most federal holidays except Memorial Day, Independence Day, and Labor Day.
operatingHours.name: George Rogers Clark National Historical Park

operatingHours.description: The George Rogers Clark Memorial is open from 9 am until 4:45 pm on demand. Before going over to the memorial, please make sure to stop by the visitor center first.
operatingHours.name: George Rogers Clark Memorial

parks.description: George Washington Birthplace National Monument is located in the Northern Neck of Virginia. It encompasses 550 acres of the former Popes Creek Plantation, which is the American ancestral home of the Washington Family and where George Washington was born. In addition to a Colonial Revival farm, visitor center, and historic structures, the park also has picnic grounds and a public beach.

entranceFees.description: The park has no entrance fee
entranceFees.title: Free Entrance

parks.directionsInfo: George Washington Birthplace is located two miles from Virginia State Highway 3 on Virginia State Route 204. The park is located 38 miles east of Fredericksburg, 11 miles west of Montross, and 10 miles west of Colonial Beach.

exceptions.name: HOURS AND LOCATION CHANGE DUE TO COVID-19

operatingHours.description: The Potomac River Beach, Burial Ground, Picnic Area, and Hiking Trails are open seven days a week from 9:00-5:00. The Historic Area Grounds are open seven days a week from 9:00-4:30.
operatingHours.name: Park Grounds Operating Hours

images.title: Overlook of Popes Creek
images.altText: View of Popes Creek
images.caption: View of Popes Creek

images.title: Memorial House Museum and Colonial Kitchen
images.altText: Brick Memorial House Museum and Wooden Colonial Kitchen
images.caption: Historic Area landscape of the Memorial House and Colonial Kitchen

images.title: Viewing the Park
images.altText: Family of three standing in front of the Birthplace Monument
images.caption: Visiting the park in the 1930's

parks.weatherInfo: George Washington Birthplace can be very warm and humid in the summer months and cold and dry in the winter. Spring and fall are the best seasons to visit.
parks.name: George Washington Birthplace

parks.description: The young child known as the "Plant Doctor" tended his secret garden while observing the day-to-day operations of a 19th century farm. Nature and nurture ultimately influenced George on his quest for education to becoming a renowned agricultural scientist, educator, and humanitarian.

entranceFees.description: The park is free of admission charge.
entranceFees.title: No Entrance Fee

parks.directionsInfo: From Interstate 44, drive south on either: Interstate 49: Exit at Diamond (exit 35), then drive five miles east on highway V, and drive ¾ mile south on Carver Road to the park entrance. Highway 59: In Diamond, turn west on highway V and drive for 2 miles, and drive ¾ mile south on Carver Road to the park entrance.

operatingHours.description:
George Washington Carver National Monument is open 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM daily, except Thanksgiving Day, December 25, and January 1.  There is no park entrance fee.

We are working to increase access to the park visitor center in a phased approach. The George Washington Carver National Monument visitor center is open with limited capacity . The information desk, park store, main floor museum, multipurpose room, and restrooms will be open. The theater and upstairs discovery area will remain closed.
operatingHours.name: George Washington Carver National Monument

images.title: Statue of young George Washington Carver on the Carver trail
images.altText: Bronze status of young George Washington Carver atop a large boulder, on the Carver trail.
images.caption: "Boy Carver Statue," sculpted by Robert Amendola in 1960.

images.title: George Washington Carver NM Entrance
images.altText: An entrance sign to George Washington Carver National Monument with wildflower and plants.
images.caption: Entrance sign to George Washington Carver NM will wildflower and plants.

images.title: George Washington Carver NM Prairie
images.altText: Sunflowers in a prairie at George Washington Carver NM.
images.caption: Prairie at George Washington Carver NM with sunflowers.

images.title: George Washington Carver NM Science Classroom
images.altText: Park's science classroom with lab tables and wall exhibits on George Washington Carver.
images.caption: George Washington Carver NM science classroom modeled after one of the George Washington Carver's lab at Tuskegee Institute.

images.title: George Washington Carver Bust
images.altText: A cast concrete bust of George Washington Carver and prairie in the background.
images.caption: A cast concrete bust for George Washington Carver by Audrey Corwin, 1952.

parks.weatherInfo: George Washington Carver National Monument is located in southwestern Missouri just outside of Diamond and about 10 miles from Joplin. Summer temperatures generally range from 75-100 degrees with high humidity. Winter temperatures generally range from 0-50 degrees with periods of intermittent freezing.
parks.name: George Washington Carver

parks.description: The George Washington Memorial Parkway was designed for recreational driving. It links sites that commemorate important episodes in American history and preserve habitat for local wildlife. The parkway and its associated trails provide a scenic place to play and rest in the busy Washington, DC metropolitan area.

entranceFees.description:
Great Falls Park Vehicle Permit ($20)
7-day pass. Admits one single, private, non-commercial vehicle and all its passengers. Organized groups are not eligible for the vehicle permit. Is also valid for entrance into the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal NHP.

Great Falls Park Individual Permit ($10)
Admits one individual when entering by foot, bicycle, or equestrian. Individuals 15 years old and younger are admitted free of charge. Is also valid for entrance into the C &O Canal National Historic Park
entranceFees.title: Great Falls Park, VA

parks.directionsInfo: Directions to Parkway Headquarters From the south, take the George Washington Memorial Parkway north. Just past the CIA exit turn right into the parking lot for the US Park Police and parkway headquarters. Go through the chain link fence and take an immediate right. Follow the road down to a stop sign and turn right into the parking lot for the headquarters building.

operatingHours.description: Parkway headquarters is open Monday through Friday from 8:15 am to 4:15 pm. It is closed on Christmas Day and New Years Day.
operatingHours.name: George Washington Memorial Parkway Headquarters

operatingHours.description:
The George Washington Memorial Parkway is generally open year round, 24 hours a day. Check current conditions for information about closures due to road work and inclement weather.

Parkway headquarters is open Monday through Friday from 8:15 am to 4:15 pm. It is closed on Christmas Day and New Years Day.

Most park sites are open from 6 am to 10 pm. For hours at specific destinations along the parkway please visit the individual webpages for those sites.
operatingHours.name: The George Washington Memorial Parkway

parks.weatherInfo: Summers on the parkway are generally hot and humid, with daytime highs frequently above 90 degrees Fahrenheit and scattered afternoon thunderstorms. Please carry water while participating in physical activity and be prepared to take shelter from lightning. Winters on the parkway are generally cold, with nighttime lows frequently near freezing and occasional snowfall. Please be alert for snowplows and icy spots on roadways. Weather during spring and fall is generally moderate, but can change quickly.
parks.name: George Washington

parks.description: The Battle of Gettysburg was a turning point in the Civil War, the Union victory that ended General Robert E. Lee's second and most ambitious invasion of the North. Often referred to as the "High Water Mark of the Rebellion", Gettysburg was the Civil War's bloodiest battle and was also the inspiration for President Abraham Lincoln's immortal "Gettysburg Address".

entranceFees.description: Entrance to the park is FREE.
entranceFees.title: Park Entrance

parks.directionsInfo: Gettysburg National Military Park is located in Adams County, Pennsylvania. The museum and visitor center is located at 1195 Baltimore Pike (Route 97) with a back entrance from the Taneytown Road (State Rt. 134). From North or South, follow US 15 to Gettysburg and watch for signs to direct you to the National Park Service Museum and Visitor Center. From East or West, drive into Gettysburg on US Rt. 30, turn South on Baltimore Street (Rt. 97), and follow signs to the entrance of the visitor center.

operatingHours.description:
The battlefield and roads are open thirty minutes before sunrise to thirty minutes after sunset.
Visitors can plan their visit and obtain a listing of sunrise and sunset times by day in Gettysburg, PA at: https://sunrise-sunset.org/us/gettysburg-pa.
operatingHours.name: Battlefield Hours
